urls.title: BARDO Soundtrack Alejandro G. Iñárritu & Bryce Dessner Sets Release
urls.description: The album features an original score co-composed by Dessner and Iñárritu to accompany the profoundly moving journey of a Mexican journalist and filmmaker returning to his native country. The project is the latest collaboration between Dessner and Iñárritu, the duo having previously worked together on The Revenant soundtrack in 2015.

urls.title: Ott, LSO, Stutzmann, Barbican review - highways to hell (and back)
urls.description: In a Renaissance artist’s studio, a wannabe master proved his skill by drawing a perfect circle. Perhaps playing Beethoven’s A minor Bagatelle (aka “Für Elise”) as an encore should count as the pianist’s equivalent. At the Barbican last night, Alice Sara Ott did just that with the ubiquitous ring-tone earworm.

urls.title: Vikingur Ólafsson, great renovator of the codes of classical music - Music News
urls.description: If there is one pianist who is innovative and out of the ordinary, it is the Icelandic Vikingur Ólafsson. The latter is releasing a new album this Friday, October 7, entitled From Afar, at Deutsche Grammophon. It is his most personal album and which goes a little further in redefining the codes of the classic.

urls.title: Bryce Dessner ’98BA ’99MM returns to Yale for Schwarzman Center residency
urls.description: Bryce Dessner ’98BA ’99MM, whose work with his band The National and collaborations with such artists and ensembles as Philip Glass, Alejandro González Iñárritu, Esa-Pekka Salonen, Katia and Marielle Labèque, Steve Reich, Paul Simon, Taylor Swift, ensemble intercontemporain, the Kronos Quartet, Los Angeles Philharmonic, and others has established the guitarist and composer as a curious and adventuresome creator, is returning to New Haven for a multiyear residency at the Yale Schwarzman Center.

urls.title: Esa-Pekka Salonen dirige la "Turangalîla-Symphonie" - Guarda il concerto completo | ARTE Concert
urls.description: La mistica "Damoiselle élue" di Claude Debussy e la poetico "Clocks and Clouds" di György Ligeti saranno eseguite dall'Orchestre de Paris come introduzione alla "Turangalîla-Symphony" di Messianen. Per sublimare queste tre partiture, Esa-Pekka Salonen si è circondato di musicisti eccezionali: il soprano Axelle Fanyo, i mezzosoprani Fleur Barron e Marie-Andrée Bouchard-Lesieur, il pianista Bertrand Chamayou e la strumentista Nathalie Forget.

urls.title: 15 concerts inratables pour cet automne
urls.description: Musiques - Comme d'usage, avec le retour des élèves dans les classes, voici celui des musiciens dans les salles après un été de batifolage en plein air. À la différence qu'ici l'office n'est pas en partie assuré par des types trouvés au hasard dans la rue. Il en a fallu des choix cornéliens et des revirements pour vous concocter cette sélection des concerts essentiels à voir absolument cette saison. Ce qui ne signifie pas qu'il faut bouder les autres.

urls.title: The National’s Bryce Dessner Named Artist-In-Residence At Yale’s Schwarzman Center
urls.description: The National‘s Bryce Dessner is returning to his pre-fame alma mater of Yale as the first Artist-In-Residence at the university’s newly opened Schwarzman Center. Dessner has “curated and commissioned new multi-disciplinary works from a roster of creators” such as Julia Bullock, Ash Fure, Nathalie Joachim, Kaneza Schaal and Anna Thorvaldsdóttir, which will be performed over the next year. He will also hold free master classes for Yale students and alumni.

data.text:
.@bryce_dessner announced as first Artist-In-Residence at his alma mater #YaleSchwarzman Center. Dessner has curated and commissioned new works from creators incl. @_JuliaBullock #ashfure @NathalieJoachim #KanezaSchaal & @annathorvalds 
https://t.co/nkV8Z1tOOG

urls.title: So You Want to Be a TikTok Star
urls.description: The social-media platform is transforming the music industry. Is that a good thing?

tweets.text: Really interesting piece on TikTok-powered pop stardom. Given how industrialised it’s become by the music industry, “cool” is surely soon to be subsumed by “naff”. https://t.co/3BynU6BV0s

There were so many excellent guesses, but the truth is that this is called 'Advent' and it was written by my father, Ólafur Óskar Axelsson, who is an architect and composer. I have so many childhood memories of dad playing this little psalm softly on our Steinway during advent ☺️ https://t.co/ZpSf0qDURW

urls.title: NPR's favorite music of October, from ancestral grooves to hip-hop nostalgia : All Songs Considered
urls.description: Open Mike Eagle confronted the past, Natalia Lafourcade returned to original songwriting, Katie Crutchfield and Jess Williamson collaborated as Plains, Víkingur Ólafsson intimately played piano and Maral deconstructed an ancestral groove.Featured Tracks and Artists:1. Open Mike Eagle: "Burner Account" and "For DOOM" from Component System with the Auto Reverse 2. Natalia Lafourcade: "María la Curandera" from De Todas las Flores 3. Plains: "Hurricane" and "Abilene" from I Walked With You A Ways 4. Víkingur Ólafsson: Robert Schumann's Study in Canonic Form, Op. 56, No. 1 and Béla Bartók's 3 Hungarian Folks Songs from Csík, III. 'White Lily' via From Afar5. Maral: "Mari's Groove" from Ground GrooveOur panel's additional recommendations for October: • Palm, Nicks and Grazes• Loyle Carner, hugo• Moin, PasteMore from NPR Music: • Interview: Open Mike Eagle• Review: Plains, I Walked With You A Ways • Víkingur Ólafsson: Tiny Desk (Home) Concert

tweets.text: The best music released in October includes the intimate new album by pianist @VikingurMusic, who plays music by Kurtág, Bartók and Schumann on both a full-size grand piano and a small upright.  https://t.co/Mi10PB2Cep https://t.co/mTvxZQGe9z

Sean is joined today by Andreas Scholl, Roberto Alagna & Aleksandra Kurzak talking about their new CD of Part's Stabat Mater and pianist Bertrand Chamayou plays live in the studio ahead of his lunchtime concert at LSO St Luke's tomorrow. https://t.co/mlF4PzKn2R

urls.title: Vikingur receives $50k Schock - Slippedisc
urls.description: The Icelandic pianist Víkingur Ólafsson has collected the...

tweets.text:
Schock for Vikingur
https://t.co/I6XeIemHhZ
My speech for the occasion, delivered in Stockholm on Tuesday by amazing (and often shockingly brilliant) @hallatweets as I was on Schumann duty w @CzechPhil in Cologne. https://t.co/uhD7wnTeKR

This is the greatest honour I could receive! Last recipient of the musical prize was György Kurtág. The other winners this year are some of my favourite thinkers: architect Rem Koolhaas, logician David Kaplan and mathematician Jonathan S. Pila. https://t.co/xzpihxRBRI

urls.title: Orchestre symphonique de Montréal, Payare & Ólafsson
urls.description: Online booking will be suspended from 9am on Fri 21 Oct until tickets for Sir Peter Blake: A Concert Celebrating His 90th Year go on sale at 10am. We are expecting high volumes of traffic, and you may experience queuing for tickets. With Víkingur Ólafsson for company, Rafael Payare leads his Orchestre symphonique de Montréal in music that fights oppression and dances with joy. Shostakovich: Symphony No.10 in E minor Run times may vary by up to 20 minutes as they can be affected by last-minute programme

tweets.text:
On Friday 28 October, the @OSMconcerts will perform at London's @southbankcentre, under the direction of @rafaelpayare. The programme will include music by Moussa, Ravel and Shostakovich, featuring soloist @VikingurMusic. 
Get your tickets below https://t.co/gyep9KcmYt

Unforgettable to visit György Kurtág in his home in Budapest and giving him From Afar - which is dedicated to him. He gave me scores with dedications and Hungarian cookies ☺️ My favourite living musician, my inspiration. https://t.co/bTtKr2QRRs

urls.title: Percussionist Jordan Ashman wins BBC Young Musician - BBC News
urls.description: The 18-year-old from Cambridgeshire is only the third percussionist to win the prestigious contest.

tweets.text:
Congratulations to Jordan Ashman who has won the @BBCYoungMus for 2022
A great win, not only for percussion, but also for contemporary music with his focussed and fiery version of Jennifer Higdon’s Percussion Concerto. 
UK percussion - next generation!! 🥳
https://t.co/X0lvNkhtqo

urls.title: "From Afar" de Víkingur Ólafsson: hors du temps, hors du monde
urls.description: Le nouvel album du "Glenn Gould islandais", comme l'a sacré le New York Times, explore des univers sonores inédits en musique classique après une rencontre intense avec le compositeur hongrois György Kurtág.

tweets.text: "From Afar" de Víkingur Ólafsson: hors du temps, hors du monde https://t.co/qMIxbotuAb

Ruminative choices on @VikingurMusic latest double CD. Also available on @DGclassics #vinyl. Inspired by a 2021 meeting with the great Hungarian composer György Kurtág, Ólafsson’s inspired repertoire choices are exquisitely recorded and even better played on both grand & upright. https://t.co/saxEqwkoRx

tweets.text:
It's fascinating to hear all your responses to the upright and grand piano versions of the songs from my new album. I've created two playlists where you can hear all these new tracks together, grouped by instrument.
Upright: https://t.co/cFaoUoxW6j
Grand: https://t.co/iRy5fQTpeV https://t.co/hPA6Uxz2aq

Icelandic pianist @VikingurMusic has a beautiful new piano arrangement of Mozart’s vocal masterpiece, Laudate Dominum.

If you haven’t heard it yet, it’s well worth a listen. 👇
